pageContext.claim: “Over the last two years our national prescription drug takeback days have collected nearly 3.7 million pounds of prescription drugs.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump gives an accurate number for the pills collected during his presidency, but his phrasing might leave the impression that this is something he started. The Drug Enforcement Administration's takeback days have collected nearly 11 million pounds (more than 5,400 tons) of expired, unused and unwanted prescription medications since it was started in 9 years ago under President Barack Obama. Trump also left the impression that these are all opioids, but the DEA collects all medicines and does not separate them.
